originalText.text: Great place to start your martial arts journey or to continue it. A no frills training gym where one can develop their striking and grappling skills with a supportive staff whom reinforce a very positive environment.

text.text: Great place to start your martial arts journey or to continue it. A no frills training gym where one can develop their striking and grappling skills with a supportive staff whom reinforce a very positive environment.

originalText.text: Love them! Sensei Good and Micka are amazing. Super caring, patient, and great at what they do! The facility is super clean and bright, and it's just an awesome place to train! We had a private self-defense class as a work team-building event and it was a great experience. Would 100% recommend for training or a special event!

We had a private self-defense class as a work team-building event and it was a great experience. Would 100% recommend for training or a special event!

originalText.text: I usually don’t write reviews but they deserve it. The instructors are amazing, the environment excellent, and the facility very clean.

text.text: I usually don’t write reviews but they deserve it. The instructors are amazing, the environment excellent, and the facility very clean.

originalText.text:
The attitude and customer service is definitely aggressive while hold on delay.
I did a trial lesson.  The only thing I found there was customer service without the service and as I mentioned before and I understood in this particular case if I knew it was the attitude of the place I would not have bothered at all to try and get into this business.  Although I definitely wanted to find a martial arts studio.

originalText.text:
I have spent close to a year attending this school and this is my lengthy review/description of it. Perhaps it will be of some help to someone who is considering joining.

The general atmosphere of the school is positive and welcoming. The staff are friendly, helpful and always willing to answer any questions and/or concerns one might have. This also extends to fellow students. Despite my introverted tendencies, everyone I've interacted with thus far has been kind and respectful.

I like that the school is always clean, freshly scented and super organized. If cleanliness is of concern then don't worry, that is taken care of.

The school offers changing rooms, small lockers (for like phones, wallets, keys, etc), bathrooms and showers for both men/women as well as an open space (2nd floor) to stretch, train and relax before/after class. Classes take place in the 3rd floor with lots of bags and space to train.

Here we all wear the same Tiger Schulmanns uniform (with some variations) which is pretty neat. I believe this keeps everyone under one banner, one team, and creates a sense of unity.

Finally, the instructors (we call them Joshu) and Sensei Good are top notch. They really take the time to guide you, to make sure that your technique is correct. Always encouraging and pushing students to their limits and beyond. I sense that they truly care and are passionate about our progress under their instruction.

To wrap up, my experience here has been positive. No complaints. 10/10
